intro: Amblyanthera bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá amblyanthera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
